intro: Viola muscoides, commonly known as the musk violet, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers with five petals, often with a distinctive yellow or white throat. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Viola muscoides is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
